name: Escaping the Labyrinth
content: Oh no! You've taken a wrong turn and now you're stuck in a maze. Thankfully, someone has left a map on the wall! Now all you have to do is figure out how long it'll take you to get out.
input: The first line of input consists of two integers x and y (5 ≤ x ≤ 51, 5 ≤ y ≤ 51). The following y lines each consist of x characters. Each character will be a wall (#) or an open space (.).
output: The output should consist of one integer: the minimum number of moves required to reach the end of the maze (the bottom-right corner) from the start (the top-left corner). Moves can be left, right, up, or down (no diagonals).
